unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the new era of Fintech and assess its impact on various financial and banking services.
Apply and evaluate current tools and techniques used in the finance industry.
Work as a team in applying financial modelling and spreadsheet techniques in the finance industry.
Critically analyse the latest banking regulations and tools necessary for managing bank liquidity.

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to MFin and 40cp at 8000 level) or (admission to (MBkgFin or MCom) and 60cp at 8000 level)

assessments.description: A closed book two hours test will be conducted in class.
Students are required to complete 3 sets of short answer and excel-based questions. Each set worth 5%.
Student will work in group to analyse real market data and produce a report of 1,000 - 1,500 words.
An online open book two hours and thirty minutes (2.5 hours) exam will be held during University Examination Period.
Students will work in groups to analyse real market data and produce a report of 1,000 - 1,500 words. 50% of this group work assessment will be allocated to individual performance.
A closed book two hours and thirty minutes (2.5 hours) exam will be held during University Examination Period.

data.subject_search_title: AFIN8099 - Current Issues in Banking and Finance
data.description: This unit provides students with the opportunity to integrate and advance their knowledge of banking and finance, with an international and future-focused emphasis. Contemporary topics in banking and finance will be covered, such as bank regulations, Fintech, hedge fund management, risk management, etc.; and students will examine the major challenges and impact brought about by these changes/topics. The unit's research and case-based topics approach will equip students to apply their analytical, critical and interpersonal skills to complex and contemporary real world problems, which in turn will help develop and finesse their communication skills and professional judgment. The unit will showcase several lectures presented by senior industry specialists, giving students the opportunity to connect with their topics in a meaningful way.
